lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The Philippines' restructuring of 13.2 billion dlrs of foreign debt will provide a welcome boost for the economy, but last Friday's accord with the country's 12-bank advisory committee does not imply an overnight boom, bankers and businessmen polled by Reuters said.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Business leaders said the 17-year rescheduling of commercial bank debt would give President Corazon Aquino some badly-needed breathing space, but warned her government was still in the midst of political consolidation.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Businessman Raul Concepcion, whose brother Jose is the country's trade and industry minister, said everyone could heave a sigh of relief.
